meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unwieldy.
meanings.sent1: The unwieldinesses of the old furniture made it hard to move around.
meanings.sent2: The unwieldinesses of the package made it challenging to carry.
meanings.sent3: The unwieldinesses of the giant teddy bear made it comical to watch it being carried.
meanings.sent4: The unwieldinesses of the situation weighed down on her like a heavy burden.
meanings.sent5: The unwieldinesses of the paperwork cluttered her desk like a chaotic mess.

meanings.definition: The condition of being difficult to manage or handle due to size or complexity.
meanings.sent1: The unwieldinesses of the project overwhelmed the team with its complexity.
meanings.sent2: The unwieldinesses of the traffic made the commute unbearable.
meanings.sent3: The unwieldinesses of the tangled wires turned into a frustrating puzzle.
meanings.sent4: The unwieldinesses of the problem loomed over them like a dark cloud.
meanings.sent5: The unwieldinesses of the maze confused the participants with its intricate paths.
